my life, not planning it. Hiding it. Arranging it. 

I am scared. I am scared of becoming overwhelmed. I am scared of suicide. I am scared of dieing. . .

And that is something I never thought I would ever say.

And I know that one day at a time; this too shall pass have their place just not this tweet. Not this moment. This one moment.

But as I write it, admit it, share it, acknowledge it, I realise... I am scared.

I am not actively, desperately seeking to end

helpful, hopeful.

**I am not suicidal.**

9/10

On the bright side, I have a fairly objective measure of recovery now.

@ELFTMattPreston I wish I joking. 
The ladybird symbolises messaging I was getting from adults at the time I suppose. I was so sad. I had a little funeral. I was the only guest. 
I even try to atone... if you ever see a slug or snail at a safe height during rain, I lifted it there.
So odd.

Random.
But one of the defining childhood moments was that I commited manslaughter of a ladybird. (Matchboxes are not suitable habitats; who knew üôÑ).
I genuinely wonder if my self concept & core beliefs would have been different if it wasn't for loving a ladybird too much.

much recently; by work related factors by the same factors affecting society as a whole. Taken for granted.

desperately sad. My emotional vocabulary is depleted and 'sad' is the only word I can find.

@findingmyvoice2 be taken up in supervision/reflection. Not put upon the patient.
